ee1cb8986c0c.description: We write down our mess, that we may marvel in what is same about us, wonder about what is different & embrace one another anyway without condition.
ee1cb8986c0c.name: This Glorious Mess

header.description: Exploring & Celebrating What it Means to be Human. Together.
header.title: This Glorious Mess

collectionHeaderMetadata.description: Exploring & Celebrating What it Means to be Human. Together.
collectionHeaderMetadata.title: This Glorious Mess

paragraphs.name: 3a66
paragraphs.text: I’m not just finding parts of myself I’d lost. There are parts of me I knew were there, but went ignored and neglected. Parts I either didn’t think were worth developing, or didn’t have to courage to develop. Parts I thought were weak, that I tried to cover up and hide. Now my heart is in hands that treat it with more care and kindness I allowed myself to give it. It’s these parts that are now exposed. But instead of the injuries I feared, I feel them growing strong and proud. I am now wondering why I ever tried to hide those away.

He challenges me to look at my convictions. Do they come from a place inside myself, or were they dictated by others? It is strange finding parts of yourself without ever realizing they had been lost. It’s like being tapped on the back and when you look around, someone is holding part of you and asks: “Excuse me, it this yours?” Your first reaction is more startled than happy. And confused because you can’t quite remember where this piece fit in. You have to expand your sense of self in order to include it again.

be2084cf8ebe.title: Aura, it is beautiful and hopeful.

paragraphs.text: Aura, it is beautiful and hopeful. Love it ❤ In this case, logic can go hide in the darkest corners of the universe. Here’s hoping the gods of probability work in your favour :-)
paragraphs.name: 33b3

paragraphs.text: Yes, ma’am. Thank you, Aura. I know I have mentioned this, but I am so happy to see this here and the why of it all?!?! It sends me on a serious merry-go-’round of pure glee. This, my dear one, is definitely heart work. Thank you for allowing us to host it.
paragraphs.name: d1a4

paragraphs.text: Proverbially so.
Oh, Aura, this is beautiful. I am getting all giddy and swoonish just reading this bit right here. I love it!

c9a710a5825c.title: In your power of heart-wisdom, you could rename the Atlantic Ocean.

paragraphs.text: In your power of heart-wisdom, you could rename the Atlantic Ocean.

Well…you just did. Think on this for a moment. The salt water of this Earth represents every human tear that ever fell. Yet there are creatures who thrive in it, who call it “home.” They are beautiful, they are terrible, but they do not spend one single…

c56135ad6dbb.title: One of my favorite things about your writing is the way you put your moments out like pieces of a…

paragraphs.text: One of my favorite things about your writing is the way you put your moments out like pieces of a puzzle. Your sentences always latch to each other gently and without friction; I’ll realize I love one sentence, not just because of how it rings on its own, but because of how it answers the one behind it, and meanders to the heart of the one in front…
